intro: Acontias cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or white in color. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Acontias cubensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
